overview_summary: Two neighboring landowners were identified: a local veterinarian couple and an absentee co-owner of a family-held parcel. Neither has a recorded public stance on development (0 support, 0 oppose, 2 unknown). One neighbor (the vet couple) holds medium community influence as local professionals, while the other (absent landowner) has low influence.

neighbors.name: William Sugimatsu (Davis et al.)
neighbors.claims: Public records list William Sugimatsu as a co-owner of Harlan County parcel 280002200 (with unspecified Davis family members)【Harlan County Assessor](https://harlancounty.ne.gov/webpages/assessor/assessor.html)​. There is no indication that Sugimatsu resides in Harlan County or participates in local civic affairs (his name does not appear in county board minutes or local news)【Harlan County Board Minutes](https://harlancounty.ne.gov/board_meetings/history.aspx)​. No public statements on development or energy issues by Sugimatsu were found in available sources (stance remains unreported)【Kearney Hub](https://kearneyhub.com)​.

approach_recommendations.engage: Use formal communication emphasizing financial stability. Highlight guaranteed lease income and property value protection, as an absentee owner likely prioritizes economic benefits over local considerations.

neighbors.name: Jeremy D. VanBoening & Erin M. (Loken) VanBoening
neighbors.claims: Dr. Jeremy VanBoening and Dr. Erin VanBoening are veterinarians who moved to Harlan County in 2003 to purchase and operate the Republican Valley Animal Center in Alma【Republican Valley Animal Center](https://www.repvalleyanimal.com/meet-the-staff)​. Jeremy was raised on a farm near Blue Hill, Nebraska and was active in FFA, reflecting deep roots in agriculture【Republican Valley Animal Center](https://www.repvalleyanimal.com/meet-the-staff)​. The couple has an established local business and engages with the farming community through their veterinary practice, but they have not publicly taken a stance for or against development or energy projects in the area (no such remarks found in local records)【Republican Valley Animal Center](https://www.repvalleyanimal.com/meet-the-staff)​.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in person via a trusted agriculture community member, emphasizing respect for farmland and minimal impact on livestock. Highlight local benefits (e.g., support for community services or youth agriculture programs) to align with their professional and family values.
